channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. sends aircraft carrier to South America in major escalation of military firepower
item.description: The deployment and the quickening pace of U.S. strikes, including one Friday, raised new speculation about how far the Trump administration may go in ...

item.title: DOJ hires immigration judges after months of layoffs
item.description: Judges will soon take the bench across 16 states, the Justice Department said. These include courts that saw the biggest losses of judges this year.

item.title: Pentagon "crossed this Rubicon" by sending strike group to Latin America, military analyst says
item.description: The Pentagon said the U.S. is deploying the Navy's newest and most advanced aircraft carrier, the USS Gerald R. Ford, to the Caribbean, along with its...

item.title: Why Bill Gates did a cameo in an iconic Indian TV drama
item.description: Microsoft founder and philanthropist makes a surprise appearance in former federal minister Smriti Irani's show.

item.title: Officers shoot at truck outside Coast Guard base during protests against Bay Area immigration crackdown
item.description: Officers opened fire Thursday evening at a vehicle backing into a line of police outside the U.S. Coast Guard base in Alameda.

item.title: Attacks on people like me happen every time my country has an election
item.description: The false belief that body parts of people with albinism bring wealth or luck have driven attacks.

item.title: 10/24: CBS Evening News
item.description: U.S. sending aircraft carrier strike group to Latin America; Students throw surprise wedding for their beloved principal.

item.title: The Great Brain Robbery
item.description: Economic espionage sponsored by the Chinese government is costing U.S. corporations hundreds of billions of dollars and more than two million jobs. Le...

item.title: 10/24: CBS Evening News Plus
item.description: What's behind the latest inflation numbers?; Reporter's Notebook: How art museums can make us more attentive.

item.title: Venezuela's Maduro says US 'fabricating war' as it deploys world's largest warship
item.description: The deployment of the USS Gerald R Ford marks a major escalation in what the US says is a campaign to target drug traffickers.

item.title: Thailand's former queen Sirikit dies aged 93
item.description: The mother of King Vajiralongkorn passed away "peacefully" on Friday night, according to the Thai Royal Household.

item.title: Pakistan bans hard-line Islamist party known for its fierce anti-blasphemy stance
item.description: Pakistan banned a hard-line Islamist party on Thursday, more than a week after heated clashes with police that left at least five people dead.

item.title: Coffee-driven deforestation is making it harder to grow coffee, watchdog group says
item.description: In Brazil's coffee-producing areas, more than 42,000 square miles of forest have disappeared over about two decades, says Coffee Watch. Deforestation ...

item.title: U.S. imposes sanctions on Colombia's president and family over drug trade allegations
item.description: The sanctions sharply escalate tensions with the leftist leader of a country that has traditionally been one of the closest U.S. allies in South Ameri...

item.title: In emotional speech, Zohran Mamdani defends Muslim identity against ‘racist and baseless’ attacks
Trump says tech leaders and mayor changed his mind about using federal force in San Francisco
Ontario to stop running anti-tariff advert that angered Trump
item.description: The advertisement will be paused from Monday so "trade talks can resume" with the US, Doug Ford says.

item.title: National Guard deployments in DC and Portland, Oregon, are focus of court hearings
